capabilities.name: Communicate Effectively
capabilities.description: The role requires effective liaison and communication with Aboriginal community representatives, native title groups, and NPWS staff to support joint management programs.

capabilities.name: Work Collaboratively
capabilities.description: Collaboration with diverse stakeholders, including government and Aboriginal organizations, is crucial for developing and implementing joint management programs.

capabilities.name: Plan and Prioritise
capabilities.description: Planning and prioritizing are essential for the successful delivery of administrative and project support within the joint management framework.

capabilities.name: Value Diversity
capabilities.description: Respecting and valuing diverse backgrounds, especially Aboriginal cultural knowledge and connections, are central to the role.

capabilities.name: Project Management
capabilities.description: Understanding and applying effective planning, coordination, and control methods to develop and implement joint management programs.

capabilities.name: Act with Integrity
capabilities.description: Maintaining professionalism and adherence to public sector values, especially in managing sensitive cultural heritage issues.

capabilities.name: Demonstrate Accountability
capabilities.description: Being responsible for actions and outcomes related to joint management programs, including adherence to legislation and policy.

skills.name: Cultural Knowledge
skills.description: Understanding and respecting Aboriginal cultural heritage and practices to ensure culturally appropriate outcomes.

skills.name: Stakeholder Engagement
skills.description: Effectively engaging with and managing relationships between Aboriginal communities, government agencies, and other stakeholders.

skills.name: Program Coordination
skills.description: Coordinating and implementing joint management programs that protect cultural heritage and the environment.

generalRole.title: Cultural Heritage and Environmental Program Coordinator
generalRole.description: This role involves coordinating and implementing programs that protect and manage cultural heritage and the environment, requiring a blend of administrative, project management, and cultural knowledge skills.
